articles.title: South Africa: Tension High in Sharpeville Following Violent Protests - South African News Briefs - October 18, 2024
articles.description: [allAfrica] Tension High in Sharpeville Following Violent Protests

articles.title: Mozambique: 'Stop Shooting At Peaceful Political Rallies' - Rights Group Urges Govt
articles.description: [AI London] Responding to reports that police in Mozambique's Nampula city fired at and detained supporters of opposition presidential candidate Venâncio Mondlane at a rally following disputed national elections, Amnesty International's Deputy Regional Director for East and Southern Africa, Khanyo Farise, said:

articles.title: Nigeria: Cholera - Niger State Confirms16 Deaths,165 Cases
articles.description: [Premium Times] According to the commissioner, 145 patients have been treated and discharged.

articles.title: Ethiopia: National Dialogue Commission Reports Setbacks Amid Conflict in Amhara Region, Challenges in Tigray
articles.description: [Addis Standard] Addis Abeba -- The National Dialogue Commission has reported that the ongoing militarized conflict in the Amhara region and unresolved "preliminary issues" in Tigray have posed significant challenges to its operations.

articles.title: Namibia: Cabinet Approves Drought Recommendations, Allocates N$16.8 Million for Emergency Relief
articles.description: [Namibia Economist] The Cabinet has approved recommendations from the National Drought Platform on issues such as governance, beneficiaries, transport and logistics, funding, warehousing, urban water provision, and malnutrition.

articles.title: West Africa: Ecowas Court Throws Out Lutheran Church Massacre Survivors' Case Against Liberian Government
articles.description: [FrontPageAfrica] In a blow to victims and survivors of the brutal 1990 St. Peter's Lutheran Church massacre in Liberia, the Ecowas Community Court of Justice has thrown out their case against the Liberian government. The court has ruled it lacks jurisdiction to hear their complaint which accused the Liberian government of dereliction of duty for failing to prosecute of those responsible for the mass murder.

articles.title: Kenya: High Court Suspends Gachagua's Impeachment for Constitutional Review
articles.description: [Capital FM] Nairobi -- The High Court has suspended the Senate's impeachment of Deputy President Rigathi Gachagua, pending a determination by a bench to be formed by Chief Justice Martha Koome.

articles.title: Tanzania: Who Is Tundu Lissu? Tanzania's Opposition Leader Is Fighting for Change in the Face of Fresh Attacks On Political Freedoms
articles.description: [The Conversation Africa] Tundu Lissu has become the face of opposition in Tanzania following his defiant and unrelenting criticism of the government. Since he came into the national limelight in 1995 when running for a parliamentary seat, Lissu has been a champion of democracy and human rights. He has taken on the ruling elite, exposing corruption and demanding accountability. This almost cost him his life in 2017.

articles.title: Africa: Ecomondo 2024: The Mattei Plan for Sustainable Development the Focus of the "Africa Green Growth Forum"
articles.description: [IEG] At Italian Exhibition Group's leading trade show for green technologies, from 5 th  to 8 th  November, in Rimini, Italy, focus on Africa and global environmental challenges. More than 100 African representatives and delegations from 120 foreign countries expected to attend.

articles.title: Cameroon: Ban On Reporting About President's Health Puts Cameroonian Journalists On Edge
articles.description: [VOA] Cameroonian journalists say they are grappling with a new government directive prohibiting public discourse or media coverage of President Paul Biya's health.

articles.title: Liberia: Has Speaker Koffa Survived Plot To Oust Him ?
articles.description: [Liberian Observer] If Speaker J. Fonati Koffa should be grateful for anything as he prepares to meet Pope Francis, the head of the Catholic Church, in the Italian Capital of Rome today October 18, it should be for being blessed to have brave, loyal, and devoted supporters among his colleagues in the House of Representatives, and beyond.

articles.title: Africa: Internet Shutdowns - A Threat to Free Speech and Democracy in Africa
articles.description: [allAfrica] Internet shutdowns are a worrying trend in African countries, often justified during elections, protests, and periods of civil unrest, as measures to prevent the spread of misinformation or maintain public order.

articles.title: Kenya: Kindiki Nominated As Deputy President After Gachagua's Historic Impeachment
articles.description: [Capital FM] Nairobi -- President William Ruto has nominated Interior Cabinet Secretary Abraham Kithure Kindiki as Deputy President, following the impeachment of Rigathi Gachagua late Thursday night.

articles.title: Nigeria: Ten Things to Know About New R21 Malaria Vaccine Nigeria Received
articles.description: [Premium Times] The first rollout of the vaccine will be in Bayelsa and Kebbi, two states with high seasonal transmission of malaria.

articles.title: Kenya: DP Gachagua Taken Ill, 'Very Sick,' Admitted to Hospital
articles.description: [Capital FM] Nairobi -- Deputy President Rigathi Gachagua failed to appear for his cross-examination in his impeachment trial on Thursday afternoon, leaving the Senate waiting as his whereabouts remained unclear.

articles.title: Africa: Angola Committed to Secure Stability in Africa
articles.description: [ANGOP] Luanda -- Angola has said it is committed to prevent and aid sort out conflicts through diplomatic initiatives, with international and regional partners to guarantee security, stability and development in Africa, the country's president João Lourenço said Friday.

articles.title: Liberia: Audit Exposes Financial Mismanagement At National Housing Authority
articles.description: [FrontPageAfrica] Monrovia -- The National Housing Authority (NHA) of Liberia is facing intense scrutiny following the release of an audit report detailing significant deficiencies in financial management for the fiscal year ending June 30, 2017.

articles.title: Africa: Strengthening Africa's Climate Resilience - ALSF's Inaugural Ppps Units Forum In Nairobi Unveils Solutions
articles.description: [InfoWire] How can Africa's infrastructure become more resilient to climate change? A question that has become imperative as extreme climatic events such as floods, droughts and desertification multiply across many African countries, increasing the vulnerability of their already fragile infrastructure.

articles.title: Eswatini: Eswatini University Steps Up Inclusion Efforts With the Opening of Disability Support Center
articles.description: [VOA] Mbabane -- The University of Eswatini moved early this month to increase access for students with disabilities through the establishment of a Disability Support Resource Centre.

articles.title: Namibia: Central Bank Takes Steps to Promote Green Finance
articles.description: [Namibia Economist] The Bank of Namibia took the first steps to integrating sustainability into the country's financial system by hosting a thought leadership event themed "Leveraging Innovation for Green Finance."

articles.title: Liberia: PYJ Turned Whistleblower
articles.description: [New Republic] Nimba County long-serving Senator Prince Y. Johnson has accused his some of his colleagues of being involved in illicit mining in Gbarpolu, Sinoe and Grand Kru Counties.

articles.title: Kenya: Kindiki Is a Good Pick for DP, ODM Says
articles.description: [Capital FM] Kisumu -- The Orange Democratic Movement (ODM) interim party leader Governor Anyang Nyong'o has commended President William Ruto on his nominee for the Deputy President.

articles.title: Kenya: Court Rules Omar Lali Criminally Liable for Tecra Muigai's Murder
articles.description: [Capital FM] Nairobi -- A Nairobi Court has ruled that Omar Lali is criminally liable for the murder of Tecra Muigai.

articles.title: Liberia: Ministry of Justice Launches Gender Policy and Strategic Action Plan for Inclusivity
articles.description: [FrontPageAfrica] The Ministry of Justice, through its Gender and Social Inclusion Unit, has launched a Gender Policy and a five-year Strategic Action Plan aimed at promoting inclusivity across all sectors.

articles.title: Liberia: Finance and Development Planning Minister Confirms Government's Efforts to Increase Civil Servants' Salary
articles.description: [FrontPageAfrica] Monrovia -- Finance and Development Planning Minister Augustine Kpehe Ngafuan has reaffirmed the government's commitment to improving the financial status of civil servants.

articles.title: Liberia: UL Investigation Recommends Prosecution of Commerce Inspector Dorr Cooper for Academic Fraud - Several Suspended, Others Dismissed
articles.description: [FrontPageAfrica] Monrovia -- A state-run University of Liberia (UL) investigative committee has recommended the prosecution of Commerce Inspector D. Dorr Cooper for academic fraud, having found him guilty of illegally obtaining an undergraduate degree in Public Administration.

articles.title: Ethiopia: Mastercard Foundation Partner Kifiya became the First Ethiopian Fintech to Receive the 2024 "Product Innovation of the Year" Prestigious Award
articles.description: [Mastercard Foundation] On September 17, 2024, at the Global SME Finance Forum in São Paulo, Brazil, Kifiya Financial Technologies won the Global SME Finance Awards 2024's Product Innovation of the Year, marking a significant milestone for Ethiopian innovation. This award honours Kifiya's contributions to financial inclusion and SME growth in Africa. Organized by the World Bank's International Finance Corporation (IFC) SME Finance Forum, the award recognizes institutions that have delivered innovative products and

articles.title: Liberia: Cental Launches Swedish-Government Funded Corruption Case Tracker
articles.description: [FrontPageAfrica] Monrovia -- The Center for Transparency and Accountability in Liberia (CENTAL), a leading anti-corruption organization, has launched the Corruption Case Tracker (CCT) to document cases under investigation by the Liberia Anti-Corruption Commission (LACC).

articles.title: Liberia: New U.S. Envoy Visits APM Terminals, Lauds Company's Contribution to Liberia's Economic Growth
articles.description: [FrontPageAfrica] Monrovia -- The new U.S. Ambassador to Liberia, Mark Toner, paid a visit to APM Terminals Liberia, marking his first visit to the Freeport of Monrovia since his appointment. Ambassador Toner was accompanied by embassy officials Michael Aguilera (Management Counselor), Jonathan Hilton (Economic Officer), and Andrew Pigler (Economic Officer). During the visit, the U.S. delegation was hosted by APM Terminals Liberia's Managing Director, Clay Crain, and was joined by Sekou Dukuly, Managing Director of the National Port

articles.title: Liberia: CDC Chair Kowo Warns Party Lawmakers Against Plot to Remove Speaker Koffa
articles.description: [Liberian Investigator] Monrovia -- The National Chair of the opposition Congress for Democratic Change (CDC), Atty. Janga Augustus Kowo, has issued a strong warning to all CDC lawmakers in the House of Representatives to distance themselves from the ongoing effort to remove House Speaker Cllr. Jonathan Fonati Koffa.

articles.title: Liberia: Justice Minister Assures Dismissed EPs Agents
articles.description: [New Republic] Justice Minister, Cllr. Oswald Tweh has assured dismissed agents of the Executive Protection Service (EPS) of receiving their just benefits from the Liberian Government as the dismissed officers staged major protest demanding their benefits.

articles.title: Liberia: Total Chaos!
articles.description: [New Republic] Serious tension erupted at the Capitol Building yesterday between supporters of Cllr. Jonathan Fonati Koffa, Speaker of the House of Representatives and some rebel lawmakers seeking his (Koffa) removal.

articles.title: Africa: Africa Gets Its Chance to Lead the Commonwealth
articles.description: [ISS] Africa takes the reins for the first time in 20 years, but will the new secretary-general adopt a more assertive stance?

articles.description: He was speaking at the bloc’s business forum which comes ahead of the BRICS summit in the Russian city of Kazan from 22-24 October.

articles.title: Mozambique rocked by killing of two prominent opposition figures
articles.description: The death of the Podemos officials comes just days before a planned nationwide strike against the October election results.

articles.title: Global South experts see BRICS expansion as positive
articles.description: Experts from 40 think tanks were speaking at a Global South meeting ahead of the BRICS summit in Russia from 22-24 October.

articles.title: Putin warns against Ukraine's nuclear ambitions and NATO membership
articles.description: During a meeting with media representatives from BRICS nations, Russian President Vladimir Putin expressed Moscow's willingness to engage in discussions aimed at resolving the conflict in Ukraine.

articles.title: "Project 2024": How Selma inspired BRELAND's latest work
articles.description:
In recent years, BRELAND has experienced a remarkable journey. 
He travelled to Selma, Alabama, to connect with his roots in order to rejuvenate himself, following a similar visit made by his mother the previous year.

articles.title: Italian court ruling leads to migrants' return to Italy
articles.description: An Italian navy vessel returned 12 migrants to Italy from an Albanian centre on Saturday, following a court decision that questioned the Italian government's strategy to transfer migrant processing to the Balkan nation.

articles.title: Mbemba's comeback: a symbolic gesture or a tactical move?
articles.description: For the first time since his suspension in mid-July, Chancel Mbemba the Congolese defender has been brought back into the professional squad.

articles.title: Meloni's discontent with court's ruling on migrant outsourcing
articles.description: Italy’s Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni criticized judges on Friday for ruling against the right-wing government’s initiative to hold 12 migrants at newly established centers in Albania.

articles.title: 63 years later: the enigma of UN Chief Hammarskjöld's death
articles.description: A significant mystery in United Nations history remains unresolved: the 1961 plane crash that took the life of Secretary-General Dag Hammarskjöld and everyone else on board while he was attempting to negotiate peace in the Congo.

articles.title: Ivory Coast dissolves powerful student unions after deaths and a police raid
articles.description:
FESCI for years enjoyed a privileged status, and authorities looked the other way as members attacked opposition supporters on and off campus.
Former famous FESCI leaders include Charles Blé Goudé and Guillaume Soro.

articles.title: UN urges ceasefire in the wake of killing of Hamas leader
articles.description: Will the warring parties in the Middle East agree to a ceasefire in the wake of the killing of Hamas' chief? The families of Israeli hostages remain caught between deep fear and cautious optimism. Those of Palestinian prisonners continue to wait.

articles.title: South Africa asks Taiwan to move de facto embassy out of Pretoria
articles.description: In a decision seen as highlighting Beijing’s expanding sway among developing nations, it has asked Taipei to move its liaison office to Johannesburg.

articles.title: Hezbollah condemns killing of Hamas leader Sinwar as protests erupt in Jordan
articles.description: The militant group hailed Sinwar as a martyr and a symbol of resistance, emphasizing that his death would not weaken the Palestinian struggle but instead strengthen it.

articles.title: Madrid coach says Mbappé 'not affected' by reports of investigation in Sweden
articles.description: Kylian Mbappé will be back in the public eye when Real Madrid return to La Liga action at Celta Vigo on Saturday (Oct. 19).

articles.title: Ex-Fulham Captain Ronnie Gibbons accuses Mohamed Al Fayed of groping at Harrods
articles.description: “The club is profoundly troubled to learn of the experiences told today by former Women’s Team captain, Ronnie Gibbons,” Fulham said in a statement. “She has our deepest empathy and support.”

articles.title: Is Migration the only path to success for the African youth? (Africanews Debates)
articles.description: The discussion, featuring three distinguished panelists, delved into the complexities of migration and its implications for Africa’s future.

articles.title: Museum at berth brings culture to Moroccan audiences
articles.description: On a tour around the Mediterranean, a museum boat of artworks was moored at the Bouregreg quay for a week in October, bringing the festival to the Moroccan capital. The museum boat measures 47 meters in length, 18 meters in width, and features a 55-meter mast with sails.

articles.title: Russia's Putin praises economic growth of BRICS countries, says they are exceeding G7
articles.description: Putin noted that the total GDP of the members of the BRICS association is more than 60 trillion dollars and that its total share in the world gross product "confidently exceeds"   the corresponding indicators of the G7 group.

articles.title: Egypt increases fuel prices by 10% to 17%
articles.description: Egyptians have been grappling with soaring inflation as they navigate rising daily costs that reached another high over the summer including a previous 10% increase in fuel prices, a hike in subway fares and the local currency sliding against foreign currencies.

articles.title: Kenya: High Court issues order halting replacement of Rigathi Gachagua as DP
articles.description: Gachagua was removed from office late on Thursday after senators voted to impeach him on 5 out of 11 charges, including gross violation of the constitution.

articles.title: Hunter's Moon delight skywatchers across the world
articles.description: Supermoons happen when the moon is closest to the Earth, making it appear bigger and brighter than normal.

articles.title: Rwanda dismisses 'Sportswashing' claims, focuses on winning development strategy
articles.description: This effort reflects his broader strategy of positioning the country, once devastated by genocide, as a continental leader in Africa.

articles.title: Gaza Strip faces famine risks despite declining hunger levels
articles.description: More than a year into Israel's war, the Gaza Strip remains vulnerable to famine, despite a recent decrease in the number of individuals experiencing severe hunger, according to the Integrated Food Security Phase Classification (IPC), which monitors hunger crises.

articles.title: Kenya's Ruto nominates interior minister as his new deputy president
articles.description: Kithure Kindiki's appointment as Kenya's new deputy president still needs to be approved by parliament.

articles.title: U.N. envoy proposes partition as solution to Western Sahara conflict
articles.description: In a closed U.N. Security Council briefing, de Mistura proposed partition, with the southern part becoming independent and the rest integrated into Morocco under internationally recognized sovereignty. However, both Morocco and the Polisario rejected the idea.

articles.title: Israel says Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar killed in Gaza
articles.description: Israel said Sinwar was identified by dental records, fingerprints and DNA tests. Sinwar was imprisoned by Israel from the late 1980s until 2011, and during that time he underwent treatment for brain cancer — leaving Israeli authorities with extensive medical records

articles.title: Unprecedented Impeachment: Deputy President Gachagua ousted
articles.description: In an unprecedented move, Kenya's Senate on Thursday voted to impeach Deputy President Rigathi Gachagua, citing corruption and other accusations, only hours after he was hospitalized with chest pain.

articles.title: Suicide bomber at café in Mogadishu claims seven lives
articles.description: At least seven people were killed and six others were injured at a Café located near a police training facility in the capital Mogadishu, Somalia after a Suicide bomber set off an unknown device as reported by the police on Thursday.

articles.title: Fans pay tribute to former One Direction star Liam Payne
articles.description: In 2015, the One Direction fever hit South Africa as the group performed there. According to a preliminary autopsy report, Payne died of “multiple trauma” and “internal and external hemorrhage,” as the result of the fall from the balcony of a third-floor room at the hotel on Wednesday (Oct. 16).

articles.title: Mpox: Head of Africa CDC urges partners to honour pledges as death toll tops 1,000
articles.description: The estimated budget for a six-month plan put forward by Africa CDC and the World Health Organization is almost $600 million, with 55% allocated to the response to mpox in 14 affected nations and boosting readiness in 15 others.

articles.title: Nigeria to roll out a new malaria vaccine
articles.description: It will become one of the first countries to roll out the new malaria vaccine, R21, after receiving a first batch of 846,200 doses.

articles.title: UNHCR Goodwil Ambassador Theo James visits Mbera refugee camp ahead of COP29
articles.description: The United Nations refugee agency estimates Mauritania welcomes over 262,000 refugees mostly women and children from Mali. The UNHCR Goodwill ambassador met refugees, many of whom are spearheading local initiatives.

articles.title: Egypt's Economy Hard Hit by Gaza War [Business Africa]
articles.description: The Egyptian economy, already struggling for several years, has been severely impacted by the war in Gaza. The escalation of the conflict between Israel and its neighbors has become yet another obstacle to economic reforms and development in Egypt.

articles.title: France: Beninese activist Kemi Seba freed
articles.description: The pan-African activist spent almost four days in custody at the headquarters of the French interior security agency (DGSI) in Paris.

articles.title: Iranian FM, Egyptian officials hold talks on regional tensions in Cairo
articles.description: Araghchi held talks with his Egyptian counterpart Badr Abdelatty and Egyptian President Abdel-Fattah el-Sissi focusing on efforts to de-escalate Israel's conflicts against Gaza and Lebanon.

articles.title: Kenya's embattled deputy president in Hospital ahead of impeachment vote - Lawyer
articles.description: Gachagua was set to appear before the Senate to defend himself against 11 charges brought against him, but his lawyer, Paul Muite, told the Senate that Gachagua was too sick to attend.

articles.title: EU leaders summit opens with more tightened migration policy in the works
articles.description: The 27 EU leaders met in Brussels Thursday (Oct. 17) to look at plans to speed up initiatives to get unwanted migrants out of the bloc and process asylum applications far outside their borders.

articles.title: Kenyan ride-hailing company helps people with disabilities get mobile
articles.description: Ace Mobility was founded over three years ago by Daniel Gatura who had witnessed the transport challenges faced by his wheelchair-bound father.

articles.title: Aid dropped over Gaza as Israel-Hamas war continues
articles.description: U.N. humanitarian officials earlier said aid entering Gaza is at its lowest level in months and warned that critical lifelines in the territory's north, where Israel has renewed its military offensive, have been cut off.

articles.title: Climate change and conflict increase malnutrition rates in Nigeria
articles.description: Food production in the northeast of the country has been impacted by ongoing fighting which limits access to agricultural land.

articles.title: Zimbabwe to compensate white farmers 20 years after land seizures
articles.description: Foreigners will receive an initial $20 million to be shared equally among the 94 claimants

articles.title: One dead, two missing as boat with 100 migrants sinks near Greece
articles.description: A total of 97 people were rescued by a passing cargo ship and were being taken to the city of Heraklion on the island of Crete, authorities said.

articles.title: Mali's Junta Chief elevates himself to top Army rank
articles.description: The announcement was made by the Council of Ministers, which published a statement on the website of the Malian government’s general secretariat.

articles.title: Economic hardship and hunger blamed for deaths in Nigeria's deadly tanker explosion
articles.description: Deadly tanker accidents are common in Nigeria, Africa’s most populous country, where traffic regulations are not strictly enforced in many places and there is a lack of an efficient railway system to transport cargo.

articles.title: Mass burial held for victims of tanker explosion in northern Nigeria
articles.description: People often salvage fuel with cups and buckets, especially at a time when fuel prices have tripled since the government ended costly gas subsidies.

articles.title: Egypt, Spain renew calls for ceasefires in Gaza and Lebanon
articles.description: "This is the request that Spain, together with Egypt and many other partners in the international community, have been making from the very first moment that this violence and this war broke out," Spain's Foreign minister said. J​osé Manuel Albares Bueno was being hosted by his Egyptian counterpart.

articles.title: Mozambique: Ruling party leading presidential polls in all provinces- Provisional results
articles.description:
Frelimo has governed Mozambique since its independence from Portugal in 1975 and has been consistently accused of rigging elections --- an allegation it denies.

Final results are expected on the 24th of October.

articles.title: Ukrainian president presents 'victory plan'
articles.description: The plan includes geopolitical, military, economic and security provisions to be met in wartime and when war ends. Its presentation comes when Ukraine’s military is suffering losses along the eastern front as Russian forces inch closer to a strategically significant victory near the crucial logi

articles.title: Mental health crisis deepens amid ongoing conflict in eastern Congo
articles.description: According to Action Against Hunger, the number of people receiving psychosocial support in camps around Goma surged by over 200% between January and June compared to the same period last year, rising from 6,600 to more than 20,000.

articles.title: Trump and Harris focus on key voter groups as election season heats up
articles.description: As both candidates focus on key voter groups, Harris’ campaign is working to ensure Black male voters remain engaged, while Trump’s team is concentrating on mobilizing early voters, especially in swing states like Georgia and Arizona.
